step.name: Set TS Start Time
step.description: To be used later to determine how long the TS ran

defaultVarList.variable: <Rules><Rule><condition><expression type="SMS_TaskSequence_VariableConditionExpression"><variable name="Operator">equals</variable><variable name="Value">True</variable><variable name="Variable">_SMSTSInWinPE</variable></expression></condition><Variables><Variable Name="TSType_New" IsSecret="false">True</Variable><Variable Name="TSType_Upgrade" IsSecret="false">False</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><condition><expression type="SMS_TaskSequence_VariableConditionExpression"><variable name="Operator">equals</variable><variable name="Value">False</variable><variable name="Variable">_SMSTSInWinPE</variable></expression></condition><Variables><Variable Name="TSType_New" IsSecret="false">False</Variable><Variable Name="TSType_Upgrade" IsSecret="false">True</Variable><Variable Name="OSDisk" IsSecret="false">%SystemDrive%</Variable></Variables></Rule></Rules>

step.name: Set Power Scheme to High Performance
Set TSVariable (OSDVer)
step.description: OSDVer contains the version of the task sequence (i.e. 1.0, 2.5, 5.0, etc.) and is used by the script to keep the results from different versions of the sequence separated.

step.name: Set TSVariable (OSDBranch)
step.description: OSDBranch is a variable I use to identify what stage the sequence is currently (i.e. DEV/QA/PILOT/PROD). The script will use this to keep results from Development builds from skewing results from Production builds.

step.name: Set TSVariable (OSDResultsShare)
step.description: The PowerShell script that does the work of collecting the data and writing it out to the CSV file is relatively simple. It pulls in the required variables, calculates the elapsed runtime in minutes and used WMI to query the computer model. This is all the

group.name: Debugging
group.description: Only enable if needed for debugging purposes

step.name: Initialize Variables
step.description: Update the SMSTS_Build for each Windows Build Version - Temp changed TSDisableProgressUI to false for testing

defaultVarList.variable: <Rules><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="Bitlocker" IsSecret="false">True</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="TSBIOSConfiguration" IsSecret="false">True</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="TSDellUpdates" IsSecret="false">False</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="TSInstallSoftware" IsSecret="false">True</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="TSInstallUpdates" IsSecret="false">True</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="TSCustomizeOS" IsSecret="false">True</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="SMSTSSoftwareUpdateScanTimeout" IsSecret="false">900</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="PREPROD_DRIVER" IsSecret="false">FALSE</Variable></Variables></Rule><Rule><Variables><Variable Name="PREPROD_BIOS" IsSecret="false">FALSE</Variable></Variables></Rule></Rules>

step.name: Set Pause
step.description: Shows more information about PoSh being run, as well as keeping the PoSh scripts hanging around.

step.name: Set OSDLogPowerShellParameters
step.description: Shows more information about PoSh being run, as well as keeping the PoSh scripts hanging around.

step.name: Restart in Windows PE
step.description: Restart in WinPE if running through Windows

defaultVarList.variable: A new Microsoft Windows operating system is being installed. The computer must reboot to continue.

expression.variable: SELECT PCSystemType FROM Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE PCSystemType = 2
Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem where Manufacturer like "%VMware%"

group.name: 03 Dell BIOS & Driver Updates
group.description: Scan mit DCU, ob BIOS und/oder Treiber Updates vorhanden sind. Installation, wenn vorhanden.
